intro: Sanicula menziesii var. foliacea, commonly known as the broad-leaved sanicle, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant ecosystems.
